description.narrative: Stichting Wings For Aid Foundation (WFA) strives to resolve the last mile challenge of humanitarian aid logistics with its unique and scalable distribution solution, using patented self-landing delivery boxes and release mechanisms, for a RPAS solution with a cargo load of up to 160 kg. This project entails the validation of the operational model.
Below the status of project progress is provided based on the status in achieving several key milestones. This section is updated on a bi-yearly basis (July & January).

title.narrative: 4. Successful completion of 4 demonstration missions with humanitarian partner organisations

description.narrative: Demonstration missions – during which last-mile aid supplies are delivered using WFA’s solution – are crucial to validate the benefits of the innovation. Using RPAS for last-mile aid delivery allows for more flexible, faster, more cost-efficient and safer distribution of last-mile aid goods to people in need. Compared to other means of transport, WFA’s solution has the potential reach more remote locations during more challenging conditions with a 24/7 operating window against lower costs to distribute aid goods without requirement of airfields for landing and regardless of the state of infrastructure.

title.narrative: 1. Building up operational capacity: RPAS aircraft and control systems ordered and delivered

description.narrative: In order to achieve operational validation through field missions adequate operational capacity of WFA’s innovative unmanned RPAS aircraft – including patented cargo bays from which self-landing boxes can be safely dropped to a designated landing zone – is required. The process starts with placing an order at selected manufacturers, after which handover of aircraft to WFA will take place in two consecutive batches, opening up the opportunity for incremental technical improvements in between.

title.narrative: 3. Sustained operational presence in 2 focus regions for last-mile aid support achieved

description.narrative: In order to be able to start actual operations after project duration WFA will establish permanent operational presence in the selected focus regions of South Africa and Kenya. This involves setting up and organizing regional operating bases that will also be instrumental as organizational entities from which demonstrations missions are coordinated. Operations will be embedded within the local humanitarian logistical cluster based on newly created collaborations with local partners.

title.narrative: 2. Technical assistance program for missions finalized and crew trained

description.narrative: In preparation of demonstration missions to validate WFA’s operational model, WFA’s technical assistance program consisting of training materials, operational manuals and guidelines and procedures will be finalized and tailored to local circumstances in selected focus regions. The assistance program will then be implemented to train crew and local operating partners, ensuring efficient and safe practices during demonstration missions.

title.narrative: 5. Actual system proven in an operational environment

description.narrative: The project sets out to result in a body of experience, knowledge and insights that validates the added value of WFA’s last-mile aid solution toward current last mile-aid delivery practices. When the system has been proven in an operational environment, WFA is ready to introduce its solution on the market in close collaboration with its humanitarian partners. This would allow WFA to start fulfilling its mission to contribute to reaching people in need of emergency support through an innovative transport concept.
